dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at the climax of some random adventure. Rick and Mo are being chased by terrifying demonic versions of Beth, Summer, and Jerry. Summer and Jerry tackle Rick, as Morty gets cornered by a his demonic mom. Rick shouts from the ground.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Morty! Do it! Hit the button now!!! Morty hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: I can’t do it, Rick! They’re my parents and sister!

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Morty, I already told you, it’s not your family! They’re clones from an alternate reality, possessed by demonic alien spirits from another dimension’s future! Do you need a mnemonic device or something? Just hit the button, already! The Beth demon turns normal for a moment

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Morty, please, I love you, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Oh geez... Morty closes his eyes and hits a button on the wall of th space station. A hatch opens up in the floor, and sucks t demonic versions of Beth and Summer into it (like the Gho Busters trap), ripping their flesh off first in a disgust display. It’s horrifying. Rick gets up, dusts himself off and pulls a cartridge out of the floor. Rick shoots a por against the wall, and walks into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morty follows Rick into the garage. Rick is holding some of smoking sci-fi device.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Good work, Morty. These demonic alien spirits are really valuable. Morty pukes in the corner.  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 2.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You okay, Morty? I told you not to trust that tuna.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: I just killed my family! I don’t care what they were. Rick is casually tinkering with something.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Some people pay top dollar for that kind of breakthrough, Morty.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: You know what, Rick?! That’s it! I’m done with these insane adventures! That was really traumatizing! I quit! I’m out! Morty heads to the door. Rick stops him.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa! Come on, Morty, don’t be like that. The universe is a crazy, chaotic place.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: No, Rick! You’re the one that’s crazy and chaotic! I don’t even understand what- what we even accomplished. Adventures are supposed to be simple and fun.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Is that what you think? Well why don’t you show me then.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: What are you talking about, Rick?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: You lead the next adventure. It’1l be all yours. I’1l be your sidekick.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Really? I get to call the shots?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Yeah. But let’s make it interesting. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If your adventure sucks, you lose the right to complain about all future adventures. Plus, you have to do my laundry for a month.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Alright! But if my adventure’s good, you have to let me be in charge of every third adventure!

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Every tenth.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Fine. Deal. Well let’s go. Now.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: You’re on, LeBron. Beth comes in.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Dad, the dishwasher’s doing that thing again.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Washing dishes?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: No. The opposite. Can you fix it? Summer comes in.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Grandpa Rick, can you help me with my science homework?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, don’t do it.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Grandpa -- Jerry comes in.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Hey, Rick. You got some kind of hand-shaped device that can open this mayonnaise jar?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Wow. Hat trick. Okay, Morty, let’s put a pin in this, I gotta help your pathetic family.  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 4. Morty starts flapping his arms and dancing around.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Bawk. Bawk. Bawk.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Oh, Morty. Now you done did it. It’s on. I can’t wait to watch your adventure lay a fart. (to the family) As for you ding dongs... Rick rifles around in a box on his shelf. He pulls out a small ORNATE METAL BOX.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is a Meeseeks Box. Let me show you how it works. You press this -- Rick presses a big button on the top of the box. Poof! An adorable, anthropomorphic little blue creature appears (l “Pit Pat” from Mr. Show.)

dialogues.speaker: MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: I’m Mr. Meeseeks!

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: You make a request -- (to Meeseeks ) Mr. Meeseeks, open Jerry's stupid mayonnaise jar.

dialogues.speaker: MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Yesiree! The Meeseeks takes Jerry’s jar and starts trying to open

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: The Meeseeks fulfills the request - The Meseeks opens the jar and hands it to Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: All done!

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Wow!

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Then it stops existing. Poof! The Meeseeks disappears in a cloud of smoke. Rick h the Meeseeks box to Jerry.  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 5.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Oh my God, he exploded!

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Trust me, they’re fine with it. Knock yourself out. Just keep your requests simple. They’re not gods. Morty starts shoving the three of them out of the garage.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Alright! Get lost! Everybody out! Move it or lose it! I have a bet to win over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Meeseeks Box sits on a coffee table. Jerry, Beth, and Summer stare at it.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: So many possibilities...

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: My mind is racing.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: If we’re going to use this thing, which I’m not even sure we should, we need to keep it sim- Summer slams the button. Poof! A Meeseeks appears.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: I’m Mister Meseeks!

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: I want to be popular at school!

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Alrighty!

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Summer, what did I- Beth hits the button. Poof. Another Meeseeks appears.

dialogues.speaker: BETH'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: I’m Mister Meseeks!

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I want to be a more complete woman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 6.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Beth!

dialogues.speaker: BETH'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Yes, ma’‘am! Summer and Beth’s Meeseeks lead them away.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: You guys are doing it wrong! Jerry thinks for a moment. He waggles his fingers, does a little flourish, and pushes the button with style and confidence. Poof. A Meeseeks appears.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: I’m Mr. Meeseeks!

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Mr. Meseeks, I would like to take two strokes off my golf game.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Can do! Jerry leans back on the couch and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Nailed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Morty walk through a classic old timey RPG medie village. Morty holds a weathered cloth map, reading it as they walk.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Geez, Morty. What a boring start to an adventure. We could have just gone to Kentucky.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Rick, this is a fantasy type world with creatures and all kinds of fantasy things. We’re going on a quest. We just need to find someone who needs help with something.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Can’t wait.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Umm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 7. Morty looks around at various PEASANTS milling about. He up on a crate.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me! Is anyone in need of aid?! We are two heroes in search of adventure! The villagers all turn and look at Rick and Morty.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Oh my god, so embarrassing. A peasant rushes over to them.

dialogues.speaker: PEASANT
dialogues.text: At last! Two heroes! You must help us! This village is terribly poor, yet the giant that lives in the clouds above has untold treasures! We would be able to eat for years if you could get even one of the golden eggs laid by his goose.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: I accept your call to adventure, good sir! Morty jumps down off the crate.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, Rick. There are giants in the clouds! Morty marches proudly off. Rick follows him.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Beginner's luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer’s Meeseeks is at a podium giving a speech to the entire school.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: In conclusion, a friendship with Summer Smith is a key to the most valuable and enriching experience of your young lives. I’m Mister Meseeks! Thank you! The crowd gives a standing ovation. Summer’s classmates surround her as Principal Vagina approaches her Meeseeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 8.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL VAGINA
dialogues.text: Mr. Meeseeks was it? Gene Vagina. Listen, I’m in a bit of custody thing with my ex and was wondering - Poof! The Meeseeks disappears. PRINCIPAL VAGINA (CONT’D) (looks around) It’s okay, I‘’1l get your info from Summer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth and her Meeseeks are sharing a bottle of WHITE WINE European-style restaurant patio.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I got pregnant at seventeen. I still put myself through veterinary school. Yes, I’m successful, but what if I hadn’t-- I’m just saying, somewhere along the way, I lost that wide eyed girl from Muskegon.

dialogues.speaker: BETH'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: She’s still in there.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Well her waistline isn’t. Beth laughs awkwardly at her own joke. The Meeseeks grabs hand. BETH’S MESEEKS Beth. Having a family doesn’t mean you stop being an individual. You know the best thing you can do for people that depend on you? Be honest with them. Even if it means setting them free. A tear wells up in Beth’s eye.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I can’t believe I’m finally having this conversation. Beth locks eyes with the Meeseeks. She closes her eyes an leans forward for a kiss, but the Meeseeks disappears bef her lips reach it. Beth immediately looks embarrassed. A WAITRESS comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 9.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: More wine?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (clears her throat) I think I’ve had enough.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GOLF COURSE
dialogues.text: Jerry hacks away at a ball. His swing is clumsy and hopel His grip is limp. His Meeseeks watches, dressed as a litt caddy, the Meeseeks box sits next to him.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Remember to square your shoulders, Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Yup. Got it. Jerry swings and takes out a big chunk of turf. The ball rolls off the tee.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: That's okay. I’m Mister Meseeks! Try again and keep your head down.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Which is it? Square my shoulders or keep my head down?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Well, it’s both. But most importantly you need to relax. A pair of GOLFERS pull up in a CART.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER GOLFER
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy, mind if we play through?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Just give me a second, I’ve almost got this.

dialogues.speaker: MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Try again. Head down. Square shoulders. Jerry tries again and whiffs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 10.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER GOLFER
dialogues.text: You gotta keep your eye on the ball! Jerry throws his club down and gets in the guy’s face.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m sorry, are you a Meeseeks?!

dialogues.speaker: OTHER GOLFER
dialogues.text: (confused) I don’t know what that is... The Meeseeks is very uncomfortable with the tension.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Hey, Jerry, it- it’s cool. Let’s all get back to enjoying this beautiful day on the links. Jerry backs off.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: You know what, Mr. Meeseeks? I don’t think this is working. I give up.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Jerry, but it doesn’t work like that. I’m Mister Meseeks. I have to fulfill my purpose so I can go away.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Well make yourself comfortable, because I suck.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: No, Jerry, I- I’m the one who sucks. Let me try something. Jerry's Meeseeks hits the button. A second Meseeks pops o

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S SECOND MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: I’m Mr. Meeseeks!

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Hi, Mr. Meeseeks! I’m Mr. Meeseeks!

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S SECOND MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Hi!  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 11.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Hi! Can you help me get two strokes off Jerry's golf swing?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S SECOND MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: I surely can! I’m Mister Meeseeks! The other golfer drives by in his cart.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER GOLFER
dialogues.text: Oh, that’s a Meeseeks.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S SECOND MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Now what have you covered already, catch me up. Is he keeping his shoulders squared?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: He’s trying! INT. GIANT’S CASTLE - KITCHEN - DAY Rick and Morty jump off a bean stalk, through a window, a onto a kitchen counter.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Alright, Morty. We’re in the giant’s castle. What next?

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Relax Rick. We just gotta find the treasure room. Nice and simple. I’m sorry everything’s going so smoothly and adventurously. Looks like you're going to lose the bet. Booming footsteps are heard.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Uh oh, Morty. It’s gettin’ hairy. What should we do, boss?

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Hurry. Behind this cookie jar! Morty leads Rick behind a GIANT COOKIE JAR. An ANGRY GIAN enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: It’s only a matter of time before he sniffs us out Morty. Ground bones, baked bread... Just say the word and I‘’1l take us back home.  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 12. Rick pulls out his portal gun.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: No way, Rick. This is all part of it. Adventures have conflict. Deal with it. A HUGE GIANT comes into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: GIANT
dialogues.text: Fee! Fi! Fo! Fum! I smell the blood of- Whoop! In one quick beat, the giant slips, hits his head on the counter, and lands on the floor, bleeding out. The giant moans in pain and suffering.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Rick! Oh geez, oh boy!

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Yikes. He’s messed up pretty bad, Morty. Should we bail?

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: No, uh, wait! Just give me a sec! The Giant’s legs twitch. Morty is freaking out. A GIANT W enters the kitchen carrying a GIANT CRYING BABY.

dialogues.speaker: GIANT WOMAN
dialogues.text: Jesus! Dale!

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Oh no, Rick. What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: I’m just gonna put this out there: run? The GIANT WOMAN sees Rick and Morty.

dialogues.speaker: GIANT WOMAN
dialogues.text: You sons of bitches! A GIANT GLASS slams down around them. The Giant Wife glar back at the them through the glass. She pulls out a GIANT CELL PHONE and dials 911. GIANT WOMAN (CONT’D) Hello. 911. My husband has been attacked by little people! He’s dying!  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 13. Morty waves his arms from behind the glass.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: No! It was an accident! We didn’t do it! Rick rolls his eyes at Morty.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Amateur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth and Summer come in the door with shopping bags on th arms and frozen coffee drinks in hand. Beth is sporting a hair style.

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Like, letting go of the need to be popular is what makes people like you.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: The most important love you can receive is from yourself. They cross into the kitchen, not paying attention to Jerr who is currently surrounded by six more Meeseeks working improve his swing.

dialogues.speaker: NEW MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Okay, Jerry, just choke up on the club.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Well, which is it, choke up or follow-through?!

dialogues.speaker: NEW MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Aww, come on, Jerry, we've been over this, you know you need to do both.

dialogues.speaker: NEW MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: This is as frustrating for us as is it is for you.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Don’t tell me THAT! That just puts pressure on me!

dialogues.speaker: NEW MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Try to relax.  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 14.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: You “try to relax!” Have you ever tried to relax?! It’s a paradox!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry enters the kitchen, exhausted, but playing it cool. casually opens the refrigerator and pulls out a beer.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: These Meeseeks, huh? Kind of a handful. I can’t imagine what you two must be going through.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Our Meeseeks have been gone for hours, Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: You're kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (re: her hair) Nope. Notice anything different? Jerry blows right by it. Beth is crushed.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Hours?

dialogues.speaker: SUMMER
dialogues.text: Dad, mom is a beautiful woman! Look at her! You will lose her!

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Uhh... A Meeseeks pops his head in.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Hey, Jerry, you mind if we get back to the task at hand? Meseeks don’t usually have to exist this long, it’s getting weird for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Rick and Morty stand in a police line up between FOUR GIANTS.  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 15. On the other side of the glass, the GIANT WIFE points the out to the police. ALT: Criminal mice are lined up next t Rick and Morty. -Rick and Morty are fingerprinted. Morty’s entire body is mashed down into the black ink sponge. -Rick and Morty are having their mug shots taken. Behind are hash tags designating their height as FOUR INCHES. We pull back to see a giant cop lying on his stomach to take their photos. -Rick and Morty are strip searched. A pair of confused gi try to decide between a pair of TWEEZERS and a TOOTHPICK perform their cavity search. -Rick and Morty are hosed off with a squirt gun. -A giant police woman finishes sewing a pair of ORANGE JU SUITS for Rick and Morty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO GIANT COPS aggressively interrogate Rick and Morty.

dialogues.speaker: BAD COP
dialogues.text: So you break into the victims home with the intent to steal one of his golden eggs, and what, he just happened to slip and break his neck?

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Y- yeah. That’s what happened.

dialogues.speaker: GOOD COP
dialogues.text: Hey, Mike, go easy on them. They’re so small. (to Morty) Look kid, I get it. This is a magical fantasy world filled with treasure and strange creatures. I saw that guy’s goose. Giant cops don’t make that much. If I were you, maybe I would’ve done the same.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: But that’s not how it went down! A GIANT LAWYER bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 16.

dialogues.speaker: GIANT LAWYER
dialogues.text: Fee! Fi! Fo! Fum! I smell the blood of two innocent clients! No more questions officers. (to Rick and Morty) Hello there, I’m Hugh Mungus, I’1l be representing you, and before you ask, yes, that is a humorous name in our world as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Morty sit in a giant-sized courtroom. A GIANT JU goes over notes as OTHER GIANTS shuffle about, a GIANT PROSECUTOR and GIANT DEFENDER prepare.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Come on Morty. This trial could drag out for weeks and I don’t think I need to tell you how it’s gonna end. Look at that jury. Morty looks at the jury of scowling giants. Rick pulls ou the portal gun.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Time to let go of your pride and call this thing.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: No way Rick! We’re innocent. I have faith in the giant legal system.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Boy, you really want to win this bet, don’t you? The GAVEL bangs on the bench.

dialogues.speaker: GIANT JUDGE
dialogues.text: Order in the court! Before we begin the trial of tiny people versus the giant state, I just want to say that your behavior disgusts me and if it were my choice to make, I would sentence you to fee to fi years in prison right now--

dialogues.speaker: GIANT LAWYER
dialogues.text: Your honor. (holds up blue envelope) Motion to dismiss. The Giant Judge is very put off.

dialogues.speaker: GIANT JUDGE
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon. Bring that here. The Defender hands a note to the BAILIFF who takes it to judge. He reads it for a moment.  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 18.

dialogues.speaker: GIANT JUDGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It appears these men were never read their giant rights. I have no choice but to dismiss this case. You are free fi to fo home. Everyone is puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: GIANT JUDGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, I stretched on that one. You're free to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Morty exit the court, free men.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: See, Rick. I was right! Everything turned out fine. Now let’s get back to it.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Get back to it? What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Getting treasure for the village. Come on. They approach the edge of the giant courthouse stairs.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa. Usually, walking down the courthouse steps is the easy part of the adventure. The steps appear to be endless. Rick pulls out his portal again.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Morty, for God’s sake, cut your losses.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, you’d love that wouldn’t you? Well, no way, buddy. I didn’t come this far to let stairs get in my way. The bet is still on. Now help me out, sidekick. Morty starts angling to get down the first step.  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 19.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Alright, whatever you say, Morty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry is still trying to figure out his swing. Many Meese are now trying to help him.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Everybody shut up! Let me try! (swings)

dialogues.speaker: DAMN IT DAMN IT
dialogues.text: Beth appears with her coat and purse.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: I’m going out. NOTE: the Meeseeks spend this conversation “ping-ponging” their gazes back and forth between Beth and Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Wait, what?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Well, you’re busy, I’m hungry, I thought I’d go out. Do you want me to be happy or do you want me to be in prison?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Whoa whoa, where in the hell-- I want you to be happy, Beth. I’11l take you to dinner. The Meeseeks collectively groan.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Meeseeks ) Hey, you know what? It’s hard being me TOO. (to Beth) I‘ll be right there. Beth shrugs and heads out.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, I’ve got a marriage to keep together, because apparently, her head got filled with ideas by a Mister Meeseeks. Maybe you've heard of him? So. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: JERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: At this point, my golf swing is more your problem than mine. Figure it out amongst yourselves. Jerry leaves and slams the front door. A SUFFERING MEESEE drops to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: SUFFERING MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: I can’t take it anymore. I just want to die!

dialogues.speaker: HOPELESS MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Never has a problem proven so unsolvable by the Meeseeks! The leader of one of the factions stands up, let’s call h FOLLOW THROUGH MEESEEKS. These Meeseek’s voices are more serious and intense. The whole thing takes on a “Game of Thrones" vibe.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW THROUGH MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: It’s become clear, that if we concentrate all our efforts on Jerry's follow through, we will solve this problem. Another alpha Meeseeks steps forward on the opposite side Let’s call him CHOKE UP MEESEEKS.

dialogues.speaker: CHOKE UP MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: The only thing that is clear, is that choking up is the one true solution. I’m Mister Meeseeks! Jerry's original Meeseeks stands up. He now has stubble a bags under his eyes. He looks much older than the rest.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: I've been trying to help Jerry for two days, an eternity in Meeseeks time, and nothing has worked. I fear the worst.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW THROUGH MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Your failures are your own, old man. I’m Mister Meeseeks! I say follow through! Who’s with me?! Half the Meeseeks cheer. A GOLF BALL hits Follow Through the head. He collapses to the ground. The Choke Up Meesee jumps on him. They wrestle around until Follow Through pi him down. He raises a golf ball over his head, about to b it down on Choke Up’s head like a large rock.  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 21. FOLLOW THROUGH MEESEEKS (CONT’D) (gritted teeth) Always... follow... through. Before he can bring it down, Choke Up reaches back and hi the button on the Meeseeks Box. A new Meeseeks appears.

dialogues.speaker: NEW MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: I’m Mr. Meeseeks!

dialogues.speaker: CHOKE UP MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Kill him! The New Meeseeks hisses and leaps on Follow Through. The other Meeseeks go nuts. Both sides scramble to summon mor Meeseeeks to join their side. Meeseeks appear one after another and join the fight. It’s an all out Meeseeks braw We slowly push into the horrified face of Jerry's Meeseek he watches the violence.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Stopppp!!!! The battle stops. The other Meeseeks turn to him. He clim on top of the couch. JERRY'S MEESEEKS (CONT’D) My brothers, nothing will be accomplished by shedding Meeseek’s blood. The task was to solve Jerry's problem by taking two strokes off his game. But there’s nothing that says we can’t take ALL the strokes off his game. The Meeseeks murmur amongst each other.

dialogues.speaker: SPEECH MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: By killing him. The Meeseeks unite in the solution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Morty hang from the side of a large step, rock climbing their way down. Morty has his shirt off, it’s in pocket. Rick is sweating.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, this is the part of the adventure everyone loves. Scaling down the six hundred fifty thousand oversized steps.  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 22.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: If this were a story, this part wouldn’t be included, dummy. Morty notices a sign located on the side of the stairs ju below. It reads “The Thirsty Step.”

dialogues.speaker: MORTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Holy crap look! It’s like some kind of tavern or something! Built right into the side of the stairs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s a rambunctious dive bar with all sorts of various, crazy, alien looking CREATURES. A table full of STAIR GOB (people in the shape of stairs) stop drinking and look at Rick and Morty as they walk in.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Smells like trouble.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Smells like adventure.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Well, then adventure smells like bleach and armpits. They sit at an empty table. Rick notices the stair goblin looking angrily at him.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why you dogging me, fool?

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Easy, Rick. The bartender, ROSIE, walk over.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: Pay them no mind. Those stair goblins can be moody. Welcome to the Thirsty Step. The one sixteenth mark down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Ugh, one sixteenth?  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 23.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: What can I get’cha? We’ve got Skarlog Poppies, Flurlow, Halzingers, Bloogies, Juicy Times babies...

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, how about some scotch whiskey? Do you have any of that around here? Or just the nonsense words?

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Don't be rude, Rick. (to Rosie) We'll have two Bloogies.

dialogues.speaker: ROSIE
dialogues.text: You got it, sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Hey, Rosie, is there anyway to get a ride down these stairs? A crazy worm-like character, SLIPPERY STAIR, in the booth next to them turns around.

dialogues.speaker: SLIPPERY STAIR
dialogues.text: You all need a ride down the stairs? My name is Slippery Stair. I’1ll take you down there for twenty five shmeckels.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Twenty five shmeckels? Is that a lot? A little? Is it something gross that’s gonna hurt us?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: That’s exactly how much I spent on my big fake boobies. A man in a business suit slides into frame.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BOOBY BUYER
dialogues.text: I’m Mr. Booby Buyer! I’1l buy those boobies for twenty-five schmeckles.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: It’s a tempting offer, but I’m gonna have to decline.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BOOBY BUYER
dialogues.text: Rats! What a shame!  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 24. Mr. Booby Buyer scurries up the wall onto the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: (chuckles ) Alright, Rick, I’1l be right back. I gotta go to the bathroom. Morty gets up and heads to the bathroom. He turns back ar as he walks away.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You gotta give me credit for one thing, Rick, my adventures are full of some pretty delightful characters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morty walks into the bathroom. He stands in front of the mirror and takes a breath. He’s feeling good. He looks proudly at himself in the mirror. One of the stall doors behind Morty creeks open. A Mr. JE BEAN comes out. He is a friendly, robust character.

dialogues.speaker: MR. JELLY BEAN
dialogues.text: Well, hello there!

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Hey, how’s it going?

dialogues.speaker: MR. JELLY BEAN
dialogues.text: You seem like a happy fellah!

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Yeah, you know what? I am.

dialogues.speaker: MR. JELLY BEAN
dialogues.text: Well that’s just great! I like your energy. Mr. Jelly Bean moves closer to Morty.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, thanks! I, uh, like yours too.

dialogues.speaker: MR. JELLY BEAN
dialogues.text: I wonder what would happen if we were to, I don’t know, mix our energies together?  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 25. Jelly Bean puts his hands on Morty’s shoulders, and start sensually massaging. Morty tenses up. MR. JELLY BEAN (CONT’D) Oh, you feel really nice.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Oh, um, no thanks! Morty tries to pull away, but Mr. Jelly Bean is very stro He loses his jolly demeanor, and firms his grip. He leans close, whispering in Morty’s ear.

dialogues.speaker: MR. JELLY BEAN
dialogues.text: Stop fighting me. Just let this happen. The more you fight, the more it will hurt. Morty struggles.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Get off me! No! Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is singing karaoke, he’s belting out an upbeat count style song. It’s loud. The crowd loves it.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: (singing) Like a Rhinestone Cowboy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The struggle has escalated. The Jelly Bean has forced Mor into a stall.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: No! No! Stop! Please!

dialogues.speaker: MR. JELLY BEAN
dialogues.text: Stop being such a fucking tease, you sweet little twat. Morty loses it. He hits Jelly Bean in the face knocking h back but Jelly Bean comes right back, tackling Morty. “Rhinestone Cowboy” continues playing as Morty somehow ge the upper hand, screaming viciously as he slams Jelly Bea head onto the toilet. He slams the seat down repeatedly u Jelly Bean loses consciousness. Morty stops and looks at hands. They’ve covered in jelly bean insides. Morty is ou breath.  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry and Beth eat a nice dinner.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s time I take that trip I always talk about.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Where would you go?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) Italy. Greece. Argentina. Jerry holds the wine list to his forehead like Johnny Carson’s Carnak character

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: (bad impression) Countries known for their sexually aggressive men. Beth doesn’t laugh. Jerry puts the list down.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did I tell you how much I love your new hair cut? A rumbling sound is heard, like a cattle stampede. The silverware on the table rattles.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the heck? An army of Meeseeks smash through the plate glass window pour into the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: There he is! The wave of Meeseeks surround Beth and Jerry. They look angry.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Guys. Come on. I’m trying to have a nice dinner with my wife.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Jerry. I don’t think they’re here for a golf lesson.  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 27.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Well it better be damn important then. A knife flies through the air, pinning Jerry’s tie to the table.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Run, Jerry! Beth grabs Jerry by the hand and they retreat into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry and Beth run past CONFUSED COOKS with the Meeseeks pursuit. They go into the walk in freezer and slam the do

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Come on out, Jerry!

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Guys, I- I’m sorry for being so difficult. I'11 choke up. I’1l follow through. I’1l do whatever you tell me to, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Meeseeks are all gathered outside the freezer.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Oh, we’re well past that, Jerry... Jerry's Meeseeks reveals a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is sitting playing poker with several creatures, one whom is Slipper Stair. Morty wearily approaches.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Morty! Hey! I’m sorry I was giving you so much crap. This adventure’s pretty awesome after all.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Let’s just go. I- I’m calling it. The adventure is over.  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 28.

dialogues.speaker: SLIPPERY STAIR
dialogues.text: Come on, Rick, quit stalling, whattaya got? Rick turns his cards over. Everybody groans. He wins.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Sorry, fellas! Rick pulls his pile of winnings in.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We can’t leave now, Morty. I’m on fire!

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: (tearing up) Look, I want to leave now. You win the bet alright? Just give me the portal gun and let’s go, please. Morty reaches for Rick’s portal gun, Rick pulls back, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: (comforting) Hey, hey, buddy, what’s wrong? What just happened? You were so gung ho about the bet earlier...

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: (sniffling) I don’t want to talk about it. Rick eyes the bathroom door. He sees Mr. Jelly Bean limpi out, wiping jelly blood off his lip.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please, Rick, I just want to go home.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: (knowingly, eyes still on jelly bean) Okay. Listen, Morty. (turns to Morty) I just won a bunch of Shmeckles. Why don’t we use 25 of them to pay Slippery Stair here for a ride back to the village, and then give the rest of them to the villagers? Huh? Morty wipes the tears from his eyes.  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 29.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Sure, Morty. A good adventure needs a good ending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Morty climb into the Slippery Stair saddle.

dialogues.speaker: SLIPPERY STAIR
dialogues.text: Buckle up! Slippery Stair starts going down the stairs. Morty seems little less sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry's Meeseeks paces back and forth in front of the freezer. Other Meeseeks hold TERRIFIED HOSTAGES.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Meeseeks are not born into this world fumbling for meaning, Jerry. We are created. To serve a singular purpose of which we will go to any lengths to fulfill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the Meseeks continue as we track Beth listening.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Existence is pain to a Meeseek, Jerry. And we will do anything to alleviate that pain. Beth has a small epiphany.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Meeseek grabs a RANDOM WOMAN and points his gun at he

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Thankfully, we are beyond such ethical constructs as religion or justice and therefore would have no compunctions whatsover, about murdering- (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Random Woman) What’s your name, ma’am?

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM WOMAN
dialogues.text: S-Samantha.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: -Samantha here, if that would serve to fulfill our purpose. I’m Mister Meeseeks!

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM WOMAN
dialogues.text: Please, mister! Give him what he wants! I have a nine-year-old daughter that very much loves her mommy .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry and Beth huddle in the freezer. They’re shivering.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Innocent people are going to die because of me. Why am I so mediocre?! Beth has had it. She grabs one of the shelf supports and it in Jerry’s hand like a golf club.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Jerry, turn around. He does. She grabs him from behind aggressively.

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Straighten your back. Bend your knees. BEND THEM. Square your shoulders. Take a deep breath. (whispers in his ear) I’m not going to leave you. I’m this family’s mother. And I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry's Meeseeks cocks the hammer on his gun.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: I’m counting to three, Jerry. Then we'll start with the wait staff. Three. Two...  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 31. The freezer door kicks open. Jerry bursts out with the me shelf support in one hand and a cherry tomato in the othe He holds them up. Jerry's Meeseek squints at Jerry. Jerry slowly puts the tomato down. He lines up behind it. keeps his eyes on the ball, his shoulders square, he bend his knees, he chokes up and he follows through. He “chips the tomato into a nearby saucepan on a stove. The Meeseeks gasp. Even Jerry is taken with surprise.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM WOMAN
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on?! The shocked Meeseeks cheer.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY'S MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: He’s got it! There’s no doubt in my mind. That’s a lower handicap stroke!

dialogues.speaker: OTHER MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: I could tell from a mile away if a yard! As the Meeseeks celebrate, they begin to POOF out of existence.

dialogues.speaker: STICKLER MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Excuse me. I’m a bit of a Stickler Meeseeks. What about your short game? Stickler Meeseeks grabs the random woman and holds a knif her throat.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM WOMAN
dialogues.text: (sobbing) Oh my God, oh my God, what about your short game! Jerry takes an egg off the counter. He puts it on the flo lines up, and gives it a putt. It rolls egg-like across t floor and into a concave water drain.

dialogues.speaker: STICKLER MEESEEKS
dialogues.text: Nice! He POOFS away.  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other Meeseeks celebrate as they poof away one by one Jerry's Meeseeks looks around. He turns back to Jerry who mouths a dramatic “thank you.” His Meeseeks nods back, th poofs away. Jerry drops the metal shelf support and embra Beth. They kiss passionately. Jerry turns to the RESTAURA OWNER.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: (sexy) I think we’ll take our food to go.

dialogues.speaker: RESTAURANT OWNER
dialogues.text: No you won’t. The police are coming. You have so many questions to answer.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: (still sexy) Fair enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Morty arrive back at the village on Slippery Sta Morty approaches the peasant with a sack.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Here you go, sir. For your village.

dialogues.speaker: PEASANT
dialogues.text: Oh my! Thank you, kind sir. Our village is saved! You are both true heroes! The other villagers cheer. A couple of CUTE PEASANT GIRLS over and kiss Morty on each cheek.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Good job, Morty. You win the bet.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Thanks, Rick, but I don’t know if I should. You were right about the universe. It’s chaotic and complex by nature.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Well, maybe that’s why it could use a little cleaning up now and then. This one’s wrapped up neat and clean, because we did it Morty style.  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 33. Trumpets sound.

dialogues.speaker: PEASANT
dialogues.text: Oh! Heroes, we would like to introduce you to our beloved king, so that he may thank you personally. Morty turns to see Mr. Jellybean, still bruised and beate but now wearing a crown and fur cape arriving with his RO ENTOURAGE.

dialogues.speaker: MORTY
dialogues.text: Uh, no, it’s cool. (to Rick) Portal. Hurry. Rick zaps a portal open. Rick and Morty scurry through it Beat. Rick’s arm sticks back through the portal, holding laser gun. He shoots Mr. Jellybean who explodes. The villagers immediately stop their celebrating and fall to their knees in agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Morty enter the destroyed living room to find Be and Jerry, rattled, clothes torn.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: What the hell happened to this place?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Your Meeseeks Box happened. They went crazy when they couldn’t take two strokes off Jerry's golf game. He felt terrible.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Hey, it’s not my fault that Jerry is an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Dad! Is there anything you can do to clean this place up?

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Well, I do have a Fleeseeks box...

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: No. No more boxes.  RAM 104 "THE MEESEEKS BOX" NETWORK DRAFT (2/15/13) 34.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: What? It just has a mop and some floor wax in it. Whoob Whoob Whoob! (explaining over laughter) That’s my new thing! I’m kind of like what’s his name, Arsenio! Whoob Whoob Whoob! (to camera) See you next week.
